title: BBC Local Live: Sheffield and South Yorkshire on Friday 18 November 2016 - BBC News
summary: tree protester says trust 'blown ' after rustlings road felling .
snow causes problems on the region 's roads .
sheffield 's tent city has gone from park road .

documents.title: goodbye : five things we learned today
text: thanks for your company on children in need day !
i 've eaten my own body weight in cakes , but it 's all for a good cause !
i 'll be back on monday with all the latest news , sport , travel and weather from across south yorkshire .
do n't forget to get in touch !
here are five stories to keep you up-to-date :

documents.title: watch : ms sufferer walks country in wife 's memory
text: a man with ms from sheffield has raised more than £ 12,000 on his 'wobbly walk ' from john o ' groats to lands end , in memory of his late wife , tina .
all the cash will go to a therapy centre he attends .
author: Oli Constable

documents.title: rotherham mp backs head of national child abuse inquiry
text: sarah champion has given her support to alexis jay , the chairwoman of the child sexual abuse ( cse ) inquiry .
professor jay 's report exposed the cse scandal in rotherham two years ago , but she 's now under pressure in her new role .
members of the shirley oaks survivors association say they 've lost confidence in the inquiry 's leadership and have described proceedings as an 'unpalatable circus ' .
what we had in rotherham was decades of the police and council turning a blind eye to abuse .
alexis jay , over a period of about six-months , discovered at least 1,400 girls had been abused in our town . ''
author: Nick Wilson
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: sheffield takeaway fined over poor food hygiene
text: a pizza takeaway in hillsborough - given a hygiene rating of one out of five - has been ordered to pay £ 8,607 for food hygiene offences .
the owner of chatanoga in holme lane , nico cebani , pleaded guilty to not complying with five food hygiene improvement notices at sheffield magistrates ' court earlier this week .
the offences included a lack of a written food safety management system , various items of disrepair and pest-proofing works .
we hope this sends a clear message to other food outlets that we take our responsibilities to protect people 's health seriously . ''

documents.title: listen : former presenter shares his memories of praise or grumble
text: as we celebrate three decades of praise or grumble , former presenter seth bennett chats with me about his time on the show :
author: Andy Giddings
Sports Editor, BBC Sheffield

documents.title: sheffield burglar jailed
text: a man who broke into two houses in sheffield to steal cash and jewellery has been handed a 40-month prison term .
joshua howarth , 23 , of woodlands avenue , broke into the homes in grenocide and hackenthorpe between june and july this year and stole a number of items , including jewellery and cash .
i am glad we have been able to achieve justice and return the stolen property , which had sentimental and personal value to the victims .
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: family pays tribute to former sheffield wednesday star ahead of funeral
text: relatives of former sheffield wednesday striker dalian atkinson have paid tribute to him as a 'kind , caring and protective ' son and brother and spoken of their agony over his death .
the former owl died at the age of 48 after being tasered by police officers who were called to a disturbance at his father 's house in telford , shropshire , in august .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: sport : rotherham united boss still interested in free agency players
text: rotherham united manager kenny jackett has said they could still enter the market for free agent players should the opportunity arise .
the millers visit derby county in the championship tomorrow .
author: Nick Wilson
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: calls for woman who led rotherham cse inquiry to be replaced in new role
text: the labour mp , chuka umunna , has called for the chair of the child sexual abuse inquiry , professor alexis jay , to be replaced .
mr umunna was speaking after the shirley oaks survivors group - which represents 600 people who lived in children 's homes in south london - withdrew from the inquiry , calling it `` a circus '' .
alexis jay 's report into child sexual exploitation in rotherham found at least 1,400 youngsters were abused in the town between 1997 and 2013 .

documents.title: almost £ 4,000 raised at pudsey leadmill gig !
text: nearly £ 4,000 was raised at our 80s party night at the leadmill in sheffield earlier this month !
thanks to everyone who came and supported it !
it 'll be music to pudsey 's ears !
author: Nick Wilson
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: rotherham councillors set to regain more decision-making powers
text: commissioners at rotherham council have asked the government to return control of some services to the authority , because they say they 've improved .
the services include adult social care , economic growth , town centre management , waste collection , community safety , grounds maintenance and audit .
we have achieved significant improvements across the board , but we are clear there remains more to do be done , and we are determined to complete the work that we have started . ''
however , the commissioners will retain control over children 's services because there 's more work to be done there .
the council got control back over some services in february this year , after it was stripped of its powers following the child sexual exploitation scandal in 2014 .
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: remember the old army polish factory in sheffield ?
text: if so , then the people who own the building in neepsend would like to hear from you .
albyn works was built in 1875 and produced blanco polish , which was used to weatherproof army clothing and whiten tennis shoes .
it closed in the 1960s and became derelict , but is now home to around 25 companies .
author: Oli Constable

documents.title: children in need : harry and amy live
text: children in need : harry and amy live

documents.title: campaign to buy sheffield pub passes £ 160,000 mark
text: sheffield pub regulars are well on the way to buying their local after pledging more than £ 160,000 .

the impressive amount has been promised in a little over a month by drinkers at the gardeners rest , neepsend , who decided to try to buy the pub after landlord and lady eddie munelly and pat wilson decided to retire and sell up .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: watch : children in need 'fun ' in doncaster !
text: here 's how pupils at hill house school have been getting their kicks in the name of pudsey .
i 'm still drying off :
children , sponges and buckets of water .
what further incentive do you need to donate ?
# childreninneed # doncaster @ twitterid
author: Tom Ingall
Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: weather : frosty with wintry showers
text: a few wintry showers will continue this evening , especially over western hills .
eastern areas will be drier with light winds , clear spells and a widespread frost .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: your headlines this lunchtime
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: travel : snow causing problems on a638
text: if you 're planning on driving along the a638 , then take extra care .
snow 's causing hazardous conditions which is resulting in delays on the woodhead pass between the flouch roundabout in langsett and glossop .
do n't forget you can click here for all your latest travel updates .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather watchers : snow falling in sheffield
text: thanks to our weather watcher , bladeswoman , for this photo of fullwood taken this morning .
keep your weather coming and do n't forget to get in touch .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: controversial felling will 'save £ 50k '
text: controversial felling will 'save £ 50k '

documents.title: listen : council 's reaction to tree felling fall-out
text: here 's what councillor bryan lodge had to say on sheffield city council 's handling of yesterday 's tree cutting fiasco in rustlings road :
author: Toby Foster
Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: sheffield council : saving trees would cost £ 50k
text: sheffield city council claim it would have cost £ 50,000 to have saved five of the eight trees cut down near endcliffe park in the early hours of yesterday .
the independent tree panel recommended that the trees could have been spared , if footpaths were re-aligned around them .
but the council said that was too expensive .
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: children in need : little ones talk about why they are raising money
text: children from catcliffe primary talk about why they are raising money for children in need today .
such a great cause : )
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: watch : sheffield tent city a 'success ' says creator
text: the man behind tent city in sheffield , anthony cunningham , says the idea has worked in getting homeless people the help they need .
about 10 tents which were set up in park hill last month have now been taken down .
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: sport : chesterfield boss hoping for swift resolution to dave allen departure
text: chesterfield manager danny wilson says he 's hoping the club 's boardroom problems will be fixed sooner rather than later .
dave allen resigned as chairman and director after the club 's other directors said they would n't forgo interest repayments on their loans to help stabilise the club .
author: Everard Davy
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: chemical incident shuts a & e
text: the accident and emergency department at doncaster royal infirmary was cordoned off yesterday after two men had a chemcial substance thrown at them through a car window .
it happened at around 02:30 , while the pair were waiting at traffic lights on mansfield road .
the a & e unit later reopened and the men did n't suffer serious injuries as the substance thrown is thought to have been alkaline .
police are investigating .
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: mutual trust 'blown ' says arrested sheffield tree protester
text: one of the people arrested following yesterday 's early morning tree felling in rustlings road , has been speaking about her ordeal .

retired university professor jenny hockey , 70 , says transparency and democracy has 'gone out of the window ' , after contractors and police turned up at 02:00 to clear cars from the street and start cutting down the trees .
sheffield city council say maintaining the roads with the trees still there would cost too much .
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: watch : fundraising in full swing for children in need
text: today 's timetable at catcliffe primary :
it can only mean it 's children in need day !
we 're all a bit # pudsey today , coming live from catcliffe primary school @ twitterid
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: travel : snow causing problems on a628
text: there 's big disruption on the a616 langsett and a6024 holme moss road and the a628 woodhead pass , due to a broken down lorry and snow .
traffic 's blocked and queuing traffic in both directions between flouch roundabout and the holmfirth turn off in high peak .
you can check all the latest travel here .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather : grab your woolly hat and gloves !
text: heavy wintry showers today and feeling very cold with brisk winds .
eastern areas will be drier with sunny spells and lighter winds , but still cold .
author: Alina Jenkins
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: it was snowing on my way into work !
is it snowing where you are ?
i 'll be with you until 18:00 bringing you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather from across south yorkshire .
do n't forget to get in touch !
author: Claire Renwick
BBC Radio Sheffield
